page.title: 03GOODLEIGH CHURCH
page.content: There could have been a church in our village as far back as AD 1042 but the present church was rebuilt in 1881 because it was falling down.It was dedicated to Gregory the Great.The church is built of stone and so is the tower which is older than the rest of the church.There are six bells in the church tower and on Thursday nights they have bell ringing practice and on Monday nights there are handbell lessons.Goodleigh church is famous for campanology.The oldest grave dates back to 1747.The originals of the parish registers are kept at Exeter.
